definition: to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
lockout buzzer system (as used by game show contestants)

sentences.english: We compile the instruction list of AWCDPR by the method of sequence control.
sentences.chinese: 採用順序控制編程方法編寫搶答器的指令表程序。

sentences.english: This is the company's manufacturing plant safety knowledge and answer in a live game.
sentences.chinese: 這是該公司生產部車間安全知識搶答賽的一個現場。

sentences.english: The responder can be used as quiz judged device.
sentences.chinese: 該搶答器可作爲智力競賽的評判裝置。

sentences.english: The company's production department launched the "Safety, jeopardy game" activities.
sentences.chinese: 該公司生產部門開展了“安全知識搶答賽”活動。

sentences.english: The figure vies for the answering device by the subject circuit and expands the circuit to make up .
sentences.chinese: 數字搶答器由主體電路與擴展電路組成。

sentences.english: Answer to design a four-way device.
Thefigure vies for the answering device by the subject circuit andexpands the circuit to make up .
sentences.chinese: 數字搶答器由主體電路與擴展電路組成。

sentences.english: The researchers also acknowledged that the machine had benefited from the “buzzer factor.”
sentences.chinese: 研究人員也承認機器受益於“搶答器”。
下面是有關聖誕節的問題搶答遊戲。

definition: lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
to dress up and make up (like an actor)
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
